book.of.workflow 1.1.0
  • Reference

    Workflow Manager

    workflow_manager.Rd

    workflow_manager is an R6 class that helps to manage workflow-related tasks. The general idea is to set up sets of ordered actions and then selectively execute on-demand.

    Public fields

    workflows

    Holds the workflow sets (expression lists)

    log

    Holds the history of executed workflow steps Initialize the Workflow Manager

    Active bindings

    available

    Show Available workflow Sets
    $available is an R6Class active binding that prints the objects in $workflows, indicating which one is the current workflow (use $help(get) for related information)

    current

    Show or set the current workflow

    Methods

    Public methods

    • workflow_manager$new()

    • workflow_manager$manage()

    • workflow_manager$get()

    • workflow_manager$exec()

    • workflow_manager$reset()

    • workflow_manager$clone()

    Method new()

    $new initializes a new object

    Usage

    workflow_manager$new(...)

    Arguments

    ...

    Not used

    Returns

    Invisibly, the class environment Manage Workflow Sets

    Method manage()

    $manage_sets will add or remove workflow sets from $workflows A set is an ordered, named expression list which can be manually defined or created with make.workflow()

    Each of the above items can be defined according to taste, but the names must be passed as show above when action is one of 'add', 'update', 'remove', 'delete'. In addition, each element of ... must be supplied as a list (e.g., fitted = list(<objects>))

    Usage

    workflow_manager$manage(
  action,
  wf_name = private$curnt,
  ...,
  confirm.rm = quote(askYesNo("Remove %s?" %>% sprintf(wf_name))),
  chatty = FALSE
)

    Arguments

    action

    One of add, update, remove, delete, or copy given as strings or symbols:

    add

    Populate objects into a new object set stored in $workflows

    update

    Similar to add but to an existing stored object set

    remove, delete

    Remove a stored object set by name

    copy, clone

    Copy a stored object set under a new name

    wf_name

    One or more names to use for saved workflow sets

    ...

    For each term expected in a set, the object data provided in a named list, each element being the same length as wf_name

    confirm.rm

    (logical) Set to FALSE if you're feeling lucky -- punk!

    chatty

    (logical \ FALSE) Verbosity flag

    Returns

    Invisibly, the class environment Get a Saved Set of Workflow Objects

    Method get()

    $get will retrieve the object in $workflows named in wf_name out and set $current to the environment with the name of that in wf_name

    Usage

    workflow_manager$get(wf_name)

    Arguments

    wf_name

    A string or symbol of the name of the set to get

    Returns

    Invisibly, the class environment Execute a Stored Workflow Step

    Method exec()

    execute.workflow executes quoted expressions referencing read.snippet calls.

    Usage

    workflow_manager$exec(wf, wf_step, list.only = FALSE, passive = TRUE)

    Arguments

    wf

    (list) The name of the workflow object containing the workflow step expressions

    wf_step

    (string/symbol) The names of the steps to execute. Tip: label the steps in the order they should execute.

    list.only

    (logical | FALSE) When TRUE, available workflows and workflow steps are printed to console before the function exits.

    passive

    (logical | TRUE) When FALSE, workflow steps are interactively selected

    Returns

    When list.only == TRUE, the listing of workflows and corresponding steps invisibly; otherwise, nothing. Reset the Workflow Manager

    Method reset()

    $reset will clear out '$workflows' and set '$current' to NULL

    Usage

    workflow_manager$reset(confirm = TRUE)

    Arguments

    confirm

    (logical | TRUE) Set to FALSE if you're feeling lucky -- punk!

    Returns

    Invisibly, the class environment

    Method clone()

    The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

    Usage

    workflow_manager$clone(deep = FALSE)

    Arguments

    deep

    Whether to make a deep clone.
